title: Southie roommates built a massive igloo that went viral on social media. Then the vandals showed up.
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: South Boston roommates built a massive igloo over 12 days, accumulating 40 million social media views.
The igloo, standing 8.5 feet tall and 12 feet in diameter, was destroyed by vandals with a sledgehammer.
Creator Jack Tarca expressed sadness over the vandalism and aims to continue creating positive content.

title: Is Dunkin’ really giving out free left-handed mittens?
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Dunkin' will give away left-handed 'iced coffee gloves' with iced beverage purchases starting February 20.
The promotion aims to keep iced coffee drinkers' hands warm during winter, available at participating Dunkin' locations.
The giveaway, which stirred online buzz, follows Dunkin’s recent winter-themed merchandise release, including a ski suit.

title: James Van Der Beek’s best performances streaming now
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: James Van Der Beek's notable roles include Dawson Leery in 'Dawson's Creek' and Mox in 'Varsity Blues'.
'Don't Trust the B—- In Apartment 23' showcases Van Der Beek's comedic self-awareness, available for rent streaming.
The Queue highlights Van Der Beek's performances as part of its weekend streaming guide amid his passing at 48.

title: A Love Letters phone booth is at the Boston Public Library
author: Meredith Goldstein
bullets: A new Love Letters 'Tell-A-Booth' was installed at the Boston Public Library on February 12.
Visitors can leave anonymous messages or questions related to relationships, answered by columnist Meredith Goldstein.
The phone booth, designed by American Repertory Theater set team, is located at the 700 Boylston St. entrance.

title: If Boston had its own ‘Winter Olympics,’ what would the events be?
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Reddit users created imaginary Boston Winter Olympics events like 'Spot Saver Curling' and 'Storrow Drive Limbo.'
Proposed events highlight Boston's challenges, featuring 'Cop Slide Luge,' 'Charles River ice crossing,' and 'Seaport Parking Battle Royale.'
Community invited to suggest and share their own ideas for Boston-themed Winter Olympic events on Boston.com.

title: Jaylen Brown has conversation with Dana White as he toys with idea of future career in UFC after NBA
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jaylen Brown is considering a post-NBA career in boxing or UFC, having discussed it with UFC President Dana White.
Brown, 29, is achieving a career-high 29.3 points per game this NBA season with the Boston Celtics.
Brown's father was a professional boxer, and he has trained in Muay Thai, showcasing interest in combat sports.

title: Mass. man faces slew of charges after allegedly driving drunk with kids in car
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Honorio Lisboa Jr., 42, arrested by Southborough police for child endangerment and driving under the influence with children in the car.
Police found Lisboa's car with defective headlights; discovered alcohol bottles inside during an inventory search.
Lisboa faces multiple charges and an outstanding warrant from Florida; arraigned not guilty, bail set with release conditions.

title: A father in Shirley built a 20-foot snowman for his daughter
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Eric Aalerud in Shirley built a 20-foot snowman named 'Parker' that has become a local photo attraction.
The snowman project started last year and grew from 15 feet to 20 feet due to heavy snowfall.
Aalerud plans to potentially expand the snowman next winter and is considering buying professional snow-moving equipment.

title: This Braintree mom is running Boston for Mass. Eye and Ear
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Katie Nicoloro, 40, from Braintree, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon for Mass. Eye and Ear.
The Boston Marathon has been a long-time goal for Nicoloro, who sees participating as a dream come true.
Nicoloro is inspired to show her children and niece that achieving big dreams requires perseverance and determination.

title: Group of juveniles kick man into moving train at Back Bay Station
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A 27-year-old man was kicked onto a moving Orange Line train at Back Bay Station Tuesday by a group of juveniles.
The man sustained a forehead injury during the altercation, which began as a verbal dispute, according to MBTA Transit Police.
The juveniles fled the scene; police are investigating the incident, and no arrests have been made as of Wednesday morning.
